Mis-configured plugin.xml or bundle manifest? 
Moving to Equinox for comment.

Is the class com.informatixinc.rapid.plugins.core.CorePlugin an abstract class 
or an interface?  Does it have a public default constructor?  Does it extend 
org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator?

From the stack trace it looks like you are using your own manifest file and 
specifying  com.informatixinc.rapid.plugins.core.CorePlugin as the Bundle-
Activator.  If you do not have your own manifest file in your plugin then the 
eclipse runtime will generate one for you and use the 
org.eclipse.core.internal.compatibility.PluginActivator class as the Bundle-
Activator as the Bundle-Activator.

If you do have a manifest file in your plugin what is the reason?  Do you have 
some custom headers that the manifest generator cannot create?  If you do not 
have a reason for a self created manifest file then try removing the manifest 
file from your plugin and letting the runtime generate one for you.

The CorePlugin class is not abstract, and is not an interface, though it does 
implement an interface (ICorePlugin).  It does not have a public default 
constructor, and it does not extend org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator.

I'm not sure what you mean by a "manifest file".  I have no manifest file that 
I know of.

Is there any documentation that might define such requirements?  I simply 
loaded a working RCP application into M6 (from M5) and have yet to resolve the 
OSGI bundle errors.

I have successfully migrated our RCP app to M6, and this doesn't seem to be an 
issue any more.  I'm not sure what I may have done that fixed it, but I don't 
get the exception anymore.

There were a few broken API issues related to the migration that I fixed, 
perhaps that had something to do with it.

In any case, I can see no reason to maintain this issue report.
